content:
Diagnosis
	1. Right breast cancer - Grade 2 mixed ductal/lobular carcinoma
	2. Left breast cancer - Grade 2 mixed ductal/lobular carcinoma

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Bilateral wire-guided wide local excisions and sentinel lymph node biopsies

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Commenced FEC-T chemotherapy 14 Feb 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Mild peripheral neuropathy

	Summary of consultation
	I was very pleased to review [redacted name] today prior to cycle 5 of FEC-T chemotherapy. She has managed the switch from FEC to docetaxel remarkably well with only grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingertips. Her energy levels are good and she continues with daily walking. The surgical sites are healing nicely with no concerns.

On examination today, both breast wounds are well-healed. There is no lymphedema. Heart rate and blood pressure are within normal range. Blood results show stable parameters suitable for proceeding with chemotherapy.

	Further investigations
	None required at present

	Medication prescribed
	Continuing standard chemotherapy supportive medications

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks for cycle 6
	Surgical follow up with [redacted name] arranged for July 2024

	Required GP actions
	None required at present

cancer_timeline.value: Bilateral wire-guided wide local excisions and sentinel lymph node biopsies
Switched from FEC to docetaxel phase of treatment

patient_facts.value: both breast wounds well-healed, no lymphedema
heart rate and blood pressure within normal range
blood results show stable parameters suitable for chemotherapy

status_updates.value: Bilateral breast cancer, post-surgery, tolerating adjuvant FEC-T chemotherapy well with minimal side effects
proceeding with cycle 5 of FEC-T chemotherapy
oncology review in 3 weeks for cycle 6, surgical follow up in July 2024
